1{-# LANGUAGE FlexibleInstances #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Parser for token tree.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.TTree.Parse
7  ( -- * Parser
8    ToTrees (..),
9    ttrees, ttreeGroup,
10  
11    -- * Abbreviation
12    tt, tt1, ttPrint, ttDoc,
13
14    -- * Split and divide
15    splitTokensBy, splitTreesBy,
16    divideTreesBy,
17    divideTreesByBar, divideTreesByColon, divideTreesByEqual,
18  ) where
19
20import qualified Text.PrettyPrint                        as P
21import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture                as O
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                    as B
23import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token            as S
24import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.TTree.Bracket    as S
25import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.TTree.TokenTree  as S
26import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Pattern    as P
27import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.TTree.Pattern    as P
28
29-- --------------------------------------------  Parser
30
31-- | Convert to token trees.
32class ToTrees a where
33    -- | Convert to list of token trees.
34    toTrees :: a -> B.Ab [S.TTree]
35
36    -- | Convert to token tree.
37    toTree :: a -> B.Ab S.TTree
38    toTree a = ttreeGroup <$> toTrees a
39
40    -- | List of token trees or error.
41    toTrees' :: a -> [S.TTree]
42    toTrees' = B.unabort . toTrees
43
44    -- | Token tree or error.
45    toTree' :: a -> S.TTree
46    toTree' = B.unabort . toTree
47
48    -- | Pretty print token trees.
49    ppTrees :: a -> IO ()
50    ppTrees a = case toTrees a of
51                  Left ab   -> putStrLn `mapM_` B.abortMessage [] ab
52                  Right ts  -> print $ ttDoc ts
53
54    -- | Pretty print token tree.
55    ppTree :: a -> IO ()
56    ppTree a = case toTrees a of
57                 Left ab   -> putStrLn `mapM_` B.abortMessage [] ab
58                 Right []  -> return ()
59                 Right [t] -> print $ ttDoc [t]
60                 Right ts  -> print $ ttDoc [ttreeGroup ts]
61
62instance ToTrees String where
63    toTrees = ttrees . S.toks
64
65instance ToTrees [S.Token] where
66    toTrees = ttrees
67
68instance ToTrees [S.TTree] where
69    toTrees = Right
70
71-- | Parse tokens with brackets into trees.
72--   Blank tokens and comments are excluded.
73{-# DEPRECATED ttrees "Use 'toTrees' instead." #-}
74ttrees :: [S.Token] -> B.Ab [S.TTree]
75ttrees = B.trees S.getBracketType B.BracketNone . S.prepareTokens
76
77-- | Wrap trees in group.
78ttreeGroup :: [S.TTree] -> S.TTree
79ttreeGroup = B.treeWrap S.BracketGroup
80
81
82-- --------------------------------------------  Abbreviation
83
84-- | Convert string to token trees.
85{-# DEPRECATED tt "Use 'toTrees' instead." #-}
86tt :: String -> B.Ab [S.TTree]
87tt = ttrees . S.toks
88
89-- | Parse string and group it.
90{-# DEPRECATED tt1 "Use 'toTree' instead." #-}
91tt1 :: String -> B.Ab S.TTree
92tt1 = Right . ttreeGroup B.<.> tt
93
94-- | Parse string and print it.
95{-# DEPRECATED ttPrint "Use 'ppTree' instead." #-}
96ttPrint :: String -> IO ()
97ttPrint s = case tt s of
98              Left msg    -> print msg
99              Right trees -> do print $ ttDoc trees
100                                return ()
101
102-- | Get 'B.Doc' value of token trees for pretty printing.
103ttDoc :: [S.TTree] -> B.Doc
104ttDoc = dv where
105    dv = B.pprintV . map d
106    d (B.TreeL x) = B.pprint "|" B.<+> B.pprint x
107    d (B.TreeB br oc xs) =
108        let tag   = "<" ++ B.name br ++ ">"
109            treeB = B.pprint tag B.<+> brackets oc
110        in P.hang treeB 2 $ dv xs
111
112    brackets Nothing = B.pprint ""
113    brackets (Just (open, close)) =
114        B.pprintH [B.pprint open, B.pprint "--", B.pprint close]
115
116
117-- --------------------------------------------  Split and divide
118
119-- | Split token list by unquoted word.
120--   If token list contains the word,
121--   pair of /before-list/, /the-word/ and /after-list/ is returned.
122--   If does not contains the word,
123--   original token list is returned.
124--
125--   >>> let Right t = S.toks "b c"
126--   >>> splitTokensBy (== "|") t
127--   Left [ TText  CodePos {..} TextRaw "b"
128--        , TSpace CodePos {..} 1
129--        , TText  CodePos {..} TextRaw "c" ]
130--
131--   >>> let Right t = S.toks "a | b | c"
132--   >>> splitTokensBy (== "|") t
133--   Right ( [ TText CodePos {..} TextRaw "a", TSpace CodePos {..} 1]
134--         , TText CodePos {..} TextRaw "|"
135--         , [ TText  CodePos {..} TextRaw "b"
136--           , TSpace CodePos {..} 1
137--           , TText  CodePos {..} TextRaw "|"
138--           , TText  CodePos {..} TextRaw "c" ] )
139
140splitTokensBy :: O.Test String -> B.SplitList3e S.Token
141splitTokensBy p = B.splitBy p2 where
142    p2 (P.TRaw x) = p x
143    p2 _          = False
144
145raw :: O.Test String -> S.TTree -> Bool
146raw p (P.LRaw w) = p w
147raw _ _          = False
148
149-- | Split token trees by quoteless token of given string.
150splitTreesBy :: O.Test String -> B.SplitList3e S.TTree
151splitTreesBy = B.splitBy . raw
152
153-- | Divide token trees by quoteless token of given string.
154divideTreesBy :: O.Test String -> [S.TTree] -> [[S.TTree]]
155divideTreesBy = B.divideBy . raw
156
157-- | Divide token trees by vertical bar @\"|\"@.
158divideTreesByBar :: [S.TTree] -> [[S.TTree]]
159divideTreesByBar = divideTreesBy (== "|")
160
161-- | Divide token trees by colon @\":\"@.
162divideTreesByColon :: [S.TTree] -> [[S.TTree]]
163divideTreesByColon = divideTreesBy (== ":")
164
165-- | Divide token trees by equal sign @\"=\"@.
166divideTreesByEqual :: [S.TTree] -> [[S.TTree]]
167divideTreesByEqual = divideTreesBy (== "=")
168
